node.title: TikTok’s running hero, Mrs. Space Cadet, competes in her first marathon.
node.description: Thousands have followed along as Erin Azar, a self-described “slightly overweight person who drinks too much beer,” trained for the marathon.
node.content: ["Erin Azar, known as Mrs. Space Cadet on TikTok, began documenting her runs two years ago. She invited followers to join her, \u201ca slightly overweight person who drinks too much beer,\u201d as she trained for a marathon. But she didn\u2019t anticipate that millions would respond.", "\u201cOne of the first times I posted a run on TikTok it got over a million views, and I was like, \u2018That\u2019s weird,\u2019\u201d she said. \u201cEverything I saw on TikTok, Instagram and YouTube were skinny runners with really cute outfits and really cute shoes, running seven- or eight-minute miles.\u201d", "That is not how Azar would describe herself. Instead, the 37-year-old mother of three has documented runs with her loyal \u201ccheer squad\u201d (three trees in a row), admitted when she had to pee mid-run, shared how much she struggles on what she calls the \u201cbarf hill\u201d near her home and explained the awkwardness of passing walkers when their pace is close to her own.", "\u201cI felt like the really curated feeds were keeping people from feeling like they could run or try to run or work out in any way,\u201d she said. \u201cSo that\u2019s why I kept posting.\u201d", "On Sunday, Azar is sharing the progress of running the New York City Marathon \u2014 her first \u2014 with her 688,000 (and growing) followers on TikTok. She posted a video at Mile 5 of a bright morning and cheering onlookers. \u201cWe\u2019re doing it!\u201d she said. ", "In another post, while running on an incline, she sings, \u201chills don\u2019t care about your feelings.\u201d ", "But Azar has not only logged miles and followers, she has used her newfound attention to raise more than $73,000 to support the Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson\u2019s Research. "]
